'''Jan Boom''' (a.k.a. '''Fangorn''') is a long time Dutch collector and incubator of Tolkien fan activity. He is a former treasurer and audit committee member as well as an active member of [[Unquendor]]. He is also a member of other Tolkien Societies as well as a silent partner of the [[Tolkien Winkel|Tolkienwinkel]]. His pseudonym Fangorn is based on his surname Boom, meaning tree in Dutch.

==Biography==
J.H.E. (Jan) Boom is a retired [[wikipedia:Financial Controller#Business role|financial controller]] who has been active in Tolkien fandom and as an active collector for many decades. He completed the MULO in 1961.<ref>https://www.schoolbank.nl/jan-boom3</ref> He has also supported numerous Tolkien Societies financially and in kind over the decades. He is a well known attendant of Tolkien events in Europe, including the annual [[Oxonmoot]]. He has also supported initiatives around collecting Tolkien books and other material.<ref>http://www.tolkiencalendars.com/ty.html (accessed 05-12-2011)</ref><ref>http://www.tolkienguide.com/modules/newbb/viewtopic.php?viewmode=compact&order=DESC&topic_id=62&forum=8&menumode=2 (accessed 05-12-2011)</ref><ref>http://mmp.faerylands.eu/viewtopic.php?id=417 (accessed 05-12-2011)</ref><ref>http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/reviews/dutch-lotr.htm (accessed 05-12-2011)</ref><ref>http://tolkiensring.proboards.com/index.cgi?action=display&board=art&thread=299&page=19 (accessed 05-12-2011)</ref> He specializes in rare book editions, calendars and [[Mithril Miniatures]].

In recent years, Jan Boom has sold most of his collection through eBay.<ref>https://www.ebay.com/str/rolfebus</ref><ref>https://www.tolkienguide.com/profile/5</ref> Jan Boom also collected Dutch artisan ceramic tiles for a time.<ref>http://home.deds.nl/~ancotheek/reframe.htm?page=zk/zk_main.htm&frameNo=1</ref>

==Trivia==
The library of the Slovenian Tolkien Society was named Fangornova Library in Jan Boom's honor. He was a great benefactor in the early years of this society.<ref>https://fangornovaknjiznica.librarika.com/</ref>
